verses.verseString: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: اقْتَرَبَ لِلنَّاسِ حِسَابُهُمْ وَهُمْ فِي غَفْلَةٍ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Their reckoning draws nigh to men, and they turn away in heedlessness.

verses.verseString: مَا يَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ ذِكْرٍ مِنْ رَبِّهِمْ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا اسْتَمَعُوهُ وَهُمْ يَلْعَبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: There comes not to them a new Reminder from their Lord but they hear it while they sport,

verses.verseString: لَاهِيَةً قُلُوبُهُمْ ۗ وَأَسَرُّوا النَّجْوَى الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا هَلْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُكُمْ ۖ أَفَتَأْتُونَ السِّحْرَ وَأَنْتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Their hearts trifling. And they — the wrongdoers — counsel in secret: He is nothing but a mortal like yourselves; will you then yield to en - chant ment while you see?

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبِّي يَعْلَمُ الْقَوْلَ فِي السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: He said: My Lord knows (every) utterance in the heaven and the earth, and He is the Hearer, the Knower.

verses.verseString: بَلْ قَالُوا أَضْغَاثُ أَحْلَامٍ بَلِ افْتَرَاهُ بَلْ هُوَ شَاعِرٌ فَلْيَأْتِنَا بِآيَةٍ كَمَا أُرْسِلَ الْأَوَّلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Nay, say they: Medleys of dreams! nay, he has forged it! nay, he is a poet! so let him bring to us a sign such as the former (prophets) were sent (with).ᵃ

verses.verseString: مَا آمَنَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَاهَا ۖ أَفَهُمْ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Not a town believed before them which We destroyed: will they then believe?ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ إِلَّا رِجَالًا نُوحِي إِلَيْهِمْ ۖ فَاسْأَلُوا أَهْلَ الذِّكْرِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And We sent not before thee any but men to whom We sent revelation; so ask the followers of the Reminder if you know not.

verses.verseString: وَمَا جَعَلْنَاهُمْ جَسَدًا لَا يَأْكُلُونَ الطَّعَامَ وَمَا كَانُوا خَالِدِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Nor did We give them bodies not eating food, nor did they abide.ᵃ

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ صَدَقْنَاهُمُ الْوَعْدَ فَأَنْجَيْنَاهُمْ وَمَنْ نَشَاءُ وَأَهْلَكْنَا الْمُسْرِفِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Then We made Our promise good to them; so We delivered them and whom We pleased, and We de - stroyed the extravagant.

verses.verseString: لَقَدْ أَنْزَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ كِتَابًا فِيهِ ذِكْرُكُمْ ۖ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Certainly We have revealed to you a Book which will give you eminence. Do you not then understand?ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَكَمْ قَصَمْنَا مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ كَانَتْ ظَالِمَةً وَأَنْشَأْنَا بَعْدَهَا قَوْمًا آخَرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And how many a town which was iniquitous did We demolish, and We raised up after it another people!

verses.verseString: فَلَمَّا أَحَسُّوا بَأْسَنَا إِذَا هُمْ مِنْهَا يَرْكُضُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So when they felt Our might, lo! they began to flee from it.

verses.verseString: لَا تَرْكُضُوا وَارْجِعُوا إِلَىٰ مَا أُتْرِفْتُمْ فِيهِ وَمَسَاكِنِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُسْأَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Flee not and return to the easy lives which you led, and to your dwellings, that you may be questioned.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said: O woe to us! Surely we were unjust.

verses.verseString: فَمَا زَالَتْ تِلْكَ دَعْوَاهُمْ حَتَّىٰ جَعَلْنَاهُمْ حَصِيدًا خَامِدِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And this cry of theirs ceased not till We made them cut off, extinct.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاءَ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا لَاعِبِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We created not the heaven and the earth and what is between them for sport.ᵃ

verses.verseString: لَوْ أَرَدْنَا أَنْ نَتَّخِذَ لَهْوًا لَاتَّخَذْنَاهُ مِنْ لَدُنَّا إِنْ كُنَّا فَاعِلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Had We wished to take a pastime, We would have taken it from before Ourselves; by no means would We do (so).ᵃ

verses.verseString: بَلْ نَقْذِفُ بِالْحَقِّ عَلَى الْبَاطِلِ فَيَدْمَغُهُ فَإِذَا هُوَ زَاهِقٌ ۚ وَلَكُمُ الْوَيْلُ مِمَّا تَصِفُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Nay, We hurl the Truth against falsehood, so it knocks out its brains, and lo! it vanishes.ᵃ And woe to you for what you describe!

verses.verseString: وَلَهُ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَنْ عِنْدَهُ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ عَنْ عِبَادَتِهِ وَلَا يَسْتَحْسِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those who are with Him are not too proud to serve Him, nor are they weary.

verses.verseString: يُسَبِّحُونَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ لَا يَفْتُرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They glorify (Him) night and day: they flag not.

verses.verseString: أَمِ اتَّخَذُوا آلِهَةً مِنَ الْأَرْضِ هُمْ يُنْشِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Or have they taken gods from the earth who give life?

verses.verseString: لَوْ كَانَ فِيهِمَا آلِهَةٌ إِلَّا اللَّهُ لَفَسَدَتَا ۚ فَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَرْشِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
verses.verseStringB: If there were in them gods besides Allāh, they would both have been in disorder. So glory be to Allāh, the Lord of the Throne, being above what they describe!ᵃ

verses.verseString: لَا يُسْأَلُ عَمَّا يَفْعَلُ وَهُمْ يُسْأَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He cannot be questioned as to what He does, and they will be questioned.

verses.verseString: أَمِ اتَّخَذُوا مِنْ دُونِهِ آلِهَةً ۖ قُلْ هَاتُوا بُرْهَانَكُمْ ۖ هَٰذَا ذِكْرُ مَنْ مَعِيَ وَذِكْرُ مَنْ قَبْلِي ۗ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ الْحَقَّ ۖ فَهُمْ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Or, have they taken gods besides Him? Say: Bring your proof. This is the reminder of those with me and the reminder of those before me.ᵃ Nay, most of them know not the Truth, so they turn away.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا مِنْ قَبْلِكَ مِنْ رَسُولٍ إِلَّا نُوحِي إِلَيْهِ أَنَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنَا فَاعْبُدُونِ
verses.verseStringB: And We sent no messenger before thee but We revealed to him that there is no God but Me, so serve Me.

verses.verseString: وَقَالُوا اتَّخَذَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَلَدًا ۗ سُبْحَانَهُ ۚ بَلْ عِبَادٌ مُكْرَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And they say: The Beneficent has taken to Himself a son. Glory be to Him! Nay, they are honoured servantsa—

verses.verseString: لَا يَسْبِقُونَهُ بِالْقَوْلِ وَهُمْ بِأَمْرِهِ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They speak not before He speaks, and according to His command they act.ᵃ

verses.verseString: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلَا يَشْفَعُونَ إِلَّا لِمَنِ ارْتَضَىٰ وَهُمْ مِنْ خَشْيَتِهِ مُشْفِقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they intercede not except for him whom He approves, and for fear of Him they tremble.

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ يَقُلْ مِنْهُمْ إِنِّي إِلَٰهٌ مِنْ دُونِهِ فَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِيهِ جَهَنَّمَ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And whoever of them should say, I am a god besides Him, such a one We recompense with hell. Thus We reward the unjust.

verses.verseString: أَوَلَمْ يَرَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَنَّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ كَانَتَا رَتْقًا فَفَتَقْنَاهُمَا ۖ وَجَعَلْنَا مِنَ الْمَاءِ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ حَيٍّ ۖ أَفَلَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Do not those who disbelieve see that the heavens and the earth were closed up, so We rent them.ᵃ And We made from water everything living.ᵇ Will they not then believe?

verses.verseString: وَجَعَلْنَا فِي الْأَرْضِ رَوَاسِيَ أَنْ تَمِيدَ بِهِمْ وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا فِجَاجًا سُبُلًا لَعَلَّهُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And We made firm mountains in the earth lest it be convulsed with them, and We made in it wide ways that they might follow a right direction.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَجَعَلْنَا السَّمَاءَ سَقْفًا مَحْفُوظًا ۖ وَهُمْ عَنْ آيَاتِهَا مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And We have made the heaven a guarded canopy; yet they turn away from its signs.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَهُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ وَالشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ فِي فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And He it is Who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon. All float in orbits.

verses.verseString: وَمَا جَعَلْنَا لِبَشَرٍ مِنْ قَبْلِكَ الْخُلْدَ ۖ أَفَإِنْ مِتَّ فَهُمُ الْخَالِدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And We granted abiding forever to no mortal before thee. If thou diest, will they abide?

verses.verseString: كُلُّ نَفْسٍ ذَائِقَةُ الْمَوْتِ ۗ وَنَبْلُوكُمْ بِالشَّرِّ وَالْخَيْرِ فِتْنَةً ۖ وَإِلَيْنَا تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Every soul must taste of death. And We test you by evil and good by way of trial. And to Us you are returned.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَإِذَا رَآكَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِنْ يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَٰذَا الَّذِي يَذْكُرُ آلِهَتَكُمْ وَهُمْ بِذِكْرِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ هُمْ كَافِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And when those who disbelieve see thee, they treat thee not but with mockery: Is this he who speaks of your gods? And they deny when the Beneficent God is mentioned.ᵃ

verses.verseString: خُلِقَ الْإِنْسَانُ مِنْ عَجَلٍ ۚ سَأُرِيكُمْ آيَاتِي فَلَا تَسْتَعْجِلُونِ
verses.verseStringB: Man is created of haste.ᵃ Soon will I show you My signs, so ask Me not to hasten them.

verses.verseString: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And they say: When will this threat come to pass, if you are truthful?ᵃ

verses.verseString: لَوْ يَعْلَمُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا حِينَ لَا يَكُفُّونَ عَنْ وُجُوهِهِمُ النَّارَ وَلَا عَنْ ظُهُورِهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنْصَرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: If those who disbelieve but knew the time when they will not be able to ward off the fire from their faces, nor from their backs, and they will not be helped!

verses.verseString: بَلْ تَأْتِيهِمْ بَغْتَةً فَتَبْهَتُهُمْ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ رَدَّهَا وَلَا هُمْ يُنْظَرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Nay, it will come to them all of a sudden and confound them, so they will not have the power to avert it, nor will they be respited.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدِ اسْتُهْزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِنْ قَبْلِكَ فَحَاقَ بِالَّذِينَ سَخِرُوا مِنْهُمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And messengers before thee were indeed mocked, so there befell those of them who scoffed, that whereat they scoffed.ᵃ

verses.verseString: قُلْ مَنْ يَكْلَؤُكُمْ بِاللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ مِنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ ۗ بَلْ هُمْ عَنْ ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِمْ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Say: Who guards you by night and by day from the Beneficent?ᵃ Nay, they turn away at the mention of their Lord.

verses.verseString: أَمْ لَهُمْ آلِهَةٌ تَمْنَعُهُمْ مِنْ دُونِنَا ۚ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَ أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ مِنَّا يُصْحَبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Or, have they gods who can defend them against Us? They cannot help themselves, nor can they be defended from Us.

verses.verseString: بَلْ مَتَّعْنَا هَٰؤُلَاءِ وَآبَاءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ طَالَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْعُمُرُ ۗ أَفَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَنَّا نَأْتِي الْأَرْضَ نَنْقُصُهَا مِنْ أَطْرَافِهَا ۚ أَفَهُمُ الْغَالِبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Nay, We gave provision to these and their fathers, until life was prolonged to them. See they not then that We are visiting the land, curtailing it of its sides? Can they then prevail?

verses.verseString: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أُنْذِرُكُمْ بِالْوَحْيِ ۚ وَلَا يَسْمَعُ الصُّمُّ الدُّعَاءَ إِذَا مَا يُنْذَرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Say: I warn you only by revelation; and the deaf hear not the call when they are warned.

verses.verseString: وَلَئِنْ مَسَّتْهُمْ نَفْحَةٌ مِنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّكَ لَيَقُولُنَّ يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And if a blast of the chastisement of thy Lord were to touch them, they would say: O woe to us! Surely we were unjust.

verses.verseString: وَنَضَعُ الْمَوَازِينَ الْقِسْطَ لِيَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ فَلَا تُظْلَمُ نَفْسٌ شَيْئًا ۖ وَإِنْ كَانَ مِثْقَالَ حَبَّةٍ مِنْ خَرْدَلٍ أَتَيْنَا بِهَا ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِنَا حَاسِبِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We will set up a just balance on the day of Resurrection, so no soul will be wronged in the least. And if there be the weight of a grain of mustard seed, We will bring it. And Sufficient are We to take account.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ الْفُرْقَانَ وَضِيَاءً وَذِكْرًا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And certainly We gave Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for those who keep from evil,ᵃ

verses.verseString: الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ بِالْغَيْبِ وَهُمْ مِنَ السَّاعَةِ مُشْفِقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Who fear their Lord in secret and they are fearful of the Hour.

verses.verseString: وَهَٰذَا ذِكْرٌ مُبَارَكٌ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ ۚ أَفَأَنْتُمْ لَهُ مُنْكِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And this is a blessed Reminder, which We have revealed. Will you then deny it?

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ رُشْدَهُ مِنْ قَبْلُ وَكُنَّا بِهِ عَالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And certainly We gave Abraham his rectitude before, and We knew him well.ᵃ

verses.verseString: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا هَٰذِهِ التَّمَاثِيلُ الَّتِي أَنْتُمْ لَهَا عَاكِفُونَ
verses.verseStringB: When he said to his sire and his people: What are these images to whose worship you cleave?

verses.verseString: قَالُوا وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا لَهَا عَابِدِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said: We found our fathers worshipping them.

verses.verseString: قَالَ لَقَدْ كُنْتُمْ أَنْتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمْ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Certainly you have been, you and your fathers, in manifest error.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا أَجِئْتَنَا بِالْحَقِّ أَمْ أَنْتَ مِنَ اللَّاعِبِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said: Hast thou brought us the truth, or art thou of the jesters?

verses.verseString: قَالَ بَلْ رَبُّكُمْ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ الَّذِي فَطَرَهُنَّ وَأَنَا عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكُمْ مِنَ الشَّاهِدِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them; and I am of those who bear witness to this.

verses.verseString: وَتَاللَّهِ لَأَكِيدَنَّ أَصْنَامَكُمْ بَعْدَ أَنْ تُوَلُّوا مُدْبِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And, by Allāh! I will certainly plan against your idols after you go away, turning your backs.

verses.verseString: فَجَعَلَهُمْ جُذَاذًا إِلَّا كَبِيرًا لَهُمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِ يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So he broke them into pieces, except the chief of them, that haply they might return to it.ᵃ

verses.verseString: قَالُوا مَنْ فَعَلَ هَٰذَا بِآلِهَتِنَا إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said: Who has done this to our gods? Surely he is one of the unjust.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا سَمِعْنَا فَتًى يَذْكُرُهُمْ يُقَالُ لَهُ إِبْرَاهِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: They said: We heard a youth, who is called Abraham, speak of them.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا فَأْتُوا بِهِ عَلَىٰ أَعْيُنِ النَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْهَدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They said: Then bring him before the people’s eyes, perhaps they may bear witness.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا أَأَنْتَ فَعَلْتَ هَٰذَا بِآلِهَتِنَا يَا إِبْرَاهِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: They said: Hast thou done this to our gods, O Abraham?

verses.verseString: قَالَ بَلْ فَعَلَهُ كَبِيرُهُمْ هَٰذَا فَاسْأَلُوهُمْ إِنْ كَانُوا يَنْطِقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Surely (someone) has done it. The chief of them is this; so ask them, if they can speak.ᵃ

verses.verseString: فَرَجَعُوا إِلَىٰ أَنْفُسِهِمْ فَقَالُوا إِنَّكُمْ أَنْتُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Then they turned to themselves and said: Surely you yourselves are wrongdoers;

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ نُكِسُوا عَلَىٰ رُءُوسِهِمْ لَقَدْ عَلِمْتَ مَا هَٰؤُلَاءِ يَنْطِقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Then they were made to hang down their heads:ᵃ Thou knowest indeed that they speak not.

verses.verseString: قَالَ أَفَتَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنْفَعُكُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا يَضُرُّكُمْ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Serve you then besides Allāh what does you no good, nor harms you?

verses.verseString: أُفٍّ لَكُمْ وَلِمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ ۖ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Fie on you and on what you serve besides Allāh! Have you no sense?

verses.verseString: قَالُوا حَرِّقُوهُ وَانْصُرُوا آلِهَتَكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ فَاعِلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said: Burn him, and help your gods, if you are going to do (anything).

verses.verseString: قُلْنَا يَا نَارُ كُونِي بَرْدًا وَسَلَامًا عَلَىٰ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
verses.verseStringB: We said: O fire, be coolness and peace for Abraham:ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَأَرَادُوا بِهِ كَيْدًا فَجَعَلْنَاهُمُ الْأَخْسَرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And they intended a plan against him, but We made them the greater losers.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَلُوطًا إِلَى الْأَرْضِ الَّتِي بَارَكْنَا فِيهَا لِلْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We delivered him and Lot (directing them) to the land which We had blessed for the nations.

verses.verseString: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ إِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ نَافِلَةً ۖ وَكُلًّا جَعَلْنَا صَالِحِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We gave him Isaac; and Jacob, a son’s son. And We made (them) all good.

verses.verseString: وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ أَئِمَّةً يَهْدُونَ بِأَمْرِنَا وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْهِمْ فِعْلَ الْخَيْرَاتِ وَإِقَامَ الصَّلَاةِ وَإِيتَاءَ الزَّكَاةِ ۖ وَكَانُوا لَنَا عَابِدِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We made them leaders who guided (people) by Our command, and We revealed to them the doing of good and the keeping up of prayer and the giving of alms, and Us (alone) they served;

verses.verseString: وَلُوطًا آتَيْنَاهُ حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ مِنَ الْقَرْيَةِ الَّتِي كَانَتْ تَعْمَلُ الْخَبَائِثَ ۗ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمَ سَوْءٍ فَاسِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And to Lot We gave wisdom and knowledge, and We delivered him from the town which wrought abomInᵃ tion. Surely they were an evil people, transgressors;

verses.verseString: وَأَدْخَلْنَاهُ فِي رَحْمَتِنَا ۖ إِنَّهُ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We admitted him to Our mercy; surely he was of the righteous.

verses.verseString: وَنُوحًا إِذْ نَادَىٰ مِنْ قَبْلُ فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ فَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ مِنَ الْكَرْبِ الْعَظِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: And Noah, when he cried aforetime, so We answered him, and delivered him and his people from the great calamity.

verses.verseString: وَنَصَرْنَاهُ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمَ سَوْءٍ فَأَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We helped him against the people who rejected Our messages. Surely they were an evil people, so We drowned them all.

verses.verseString: وَدَاوُودَ وَسُلَيْمَانَ إِذْ يَحْكُمَانِ فِي الْحَرْثِ إِذْ نَفَشَتْ فِيهِ غَنَمُ الْقَوْمِ وَكُنَّا لِحُكْمِهِمْ شَاهِدِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And David and Solomon, when they gave judgment concerning the field, when the people’s sheep strayed therein by night, and We were bearers of witness to their judgment.

verses.verseString: فَفَهَّمْنَاهَا سُلَيْمَانَ ۚ وَكُلًّا آتَيْنَا حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا ۚ وَسَخَّرْنَا مَعَ دَاوُودَ الْجِبَالَ يُسَبِّحْنَ وَالطَّيْرَ ۚ وَكُنَّا فَاعِلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So We made Solomon to understand it. And to each (of them) We gave wisdom and knowledge. And We made the mountains, declaring (Our) glory, and the birds,ᵃ subservient to David. And We were the Doers.

verses.verseString: وَعَلَّمْنَاهُ صَنْعَةَ لَبُوسٍ لَكُمْ لِتُحْصِنَكُمْ مِنْ بَأْسِكُمْ ۖ فَهَلْ أَنْتُمْ شَاكِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And We taught him the making of coats of mail for you, to protect you in your wars; will you then be grateful?ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَلِسُلَيْمَانَ الرِّيحَ عَاصِفَةً تَجْرِي بِأَمْرِهِ إِلَى الْأَرْضِ الَّتِي بَارَكْنَا فِيهَا ۚ وَكُنَّا بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And to Solomon (We subdued) the wind blowing violent, pursuing its course by His command to the land which We had blessed, and We are ever Knower of all things.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَمِنَ الشَّيَاطِينِ مَنْ يَغُوصُونَ لَهُ وَيَعْمَلُونَ عَمَلًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَكُنَّا لَهُمْ حَافِظِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And of the devils there were those who dived for him and did other work besides that; and We kept guard over them:ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَأَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ الضُّرُّ وَأَنْتَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And Job, when he cried to his Lord: Distress has afflicted me! and Thou art the most Merciful of those who show mercy.

verses.verseString: فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ فَكَشَفْنَا مَا بِهِ مِنْ ضُرٍّ ۖ وَآتَيْنَاهُ أَهْلَهُ وَمِثْلَهُمْ مَعَهُمْ رَحْمَةً مِنْ عِنْدِنَا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِلْعَابِدِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So We responded to him and removed the distress he had, and We gave him his people and the like of them with them: a mercy from Us and a reminder to the worshippers.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ وَإِدْرِيسَ وَذَا الْكِفْلِ ۖ كُلٌّ مِنَ الصَّابِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And Ishmael and Idris and Dhu-lKifl; all were of the patient ones;ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَأَدْخَلْنَاهُمْ فِي رَحْمَتِنَا ۖ إِنَّهُمْ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We admitted them to Our mercy; surely they were of the good ones.

verses.verseString: وَذَا النُّونِ إِذْ ذَهَبَ مُغَاضِبًا فَظَنَّ أَنْ لَنْ نَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ فَنَادَىٰ فِي الظُّلُمَاتِ أَنْ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ سُبْحَانَكَ إِنِّي كُنْتُ مِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And Dhu-l-N∂n,ᵃ when he went away in wrath,ᵇ and he thought that We would not straiten him,ᶜ so he called out among afflictions:ᵈ There is no God but Thou, glory be to Thee! Surely I am of the sufferers of loss.ᵉ

verses.verseString: فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ مِنَ الْغَمِّ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُنْجِي الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So We responded to him and delivered him from grief. And thus do We deliver the believers.

verses.verseString: وَزَكَرِيَّا إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِي فَرْدًا وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الْوَارِثِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And Zacharias, when he cried to his Lord: My Lord, leave me not alone! and Thou art the Best of inheritors.ᵃ

verses.verseString: فَاسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُ وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ يَحْيَىٰ وَأَصْلَحْنَا لَهُ زَوْجَهُ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا يُسَارِعُونَ فِي الْخَيْرَاتِ وَيَدْعُونَنَا رَغَبًا وَرَهَبًا ۖ وَكَانُوا لَنَا خَاشِعِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So We responded to him and gave him John and made his wife fit for him.ᵃ Surely they used to vie, one with another, in good deeds and called upon Us, hoping and fearing; and they were humble before Us.

verses.verseString: وَالَّتِي أَحْصَنَتْ فَرْجَهَا فَنَفَخْنَا فِيهَا مِنْ رُوحِنَا وَجَعَلْنَاهَا وَابْنَهَا آيَةً لِلْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And she who guarded her chastity, a so We breathed into her of Our inspiration, and made her and her son a sign for the nations.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ أُمَّتُكُمْ أُمَّةً وَاحِدَةً وَأَنَا رَبُّكُمْ فَاعْبُدُونِ
verses.verseStringB: Surely this your community is a single community, and I am your Lord, so serve Me.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَتَقَطَّعُوا أَمْرَهُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلٌّ إِلَيْنَا رَاجِعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And they cut off their affair among them: to Us will all return.

verses.verseString: فَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِنَ الصَّالِحَاتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَا كُفْرَانَ لِسَعْيِهِ وَإِنَّا لَهُ كَاتِبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So whoever does good deeds and is a believer, there is no rejection of his effort, and We surely write (it) down for him.

verses.verseString: وَحَرَامٌ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَاهَا أَنَّهُمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And it is forbidden to a town which We destroy: they shall not return.ᵃ

verses.verseString: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا فُتِحَتْ يَأْجُوجُ وَمَأْجُوجُ وَهُمْ مِنْ كُلِّ حَدَبٍ يَنْسِلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Evena when Gog and Magog are let loose and they sally forth from every elevated place.ᵇ

verses.verseString: وَاقْتَرَبَ الْوَعْدُ الْحَقُّ فَإِذَا هِيَ شَاخِصَةٌ أَبْصَارُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا قَدْ كُنَّا فِي غَفْلَةٍ مِنْ هَٰذَا بَلْ كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And the True Promise draws nigh, then lo! the eyes of those who disbelieve will be fixedly open: O woe to us! Surely we were heedless of this; nay, we were unjust.ᵃ

verses.verseString: إِنَّكُمْ وَمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ حَصَبُ جَهَنَّمَ أَنْتُمْ لَهَا وَارِدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely you and what you worship besides Allāh are fuel of hell; to it you will come.ᵃ

verses.verseString: لَوْ كَانَ هَٰؤُلَاءِ آلِهَةً مَا وَرَدُوهَا ۖ وَكُلٌّ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Had these been gods, they would not have come to it. And all will abide therein.

verses.verseString: لَهُمْ فِيهَا زَفِيرٌ وَهُمْ فِيهَا لَا يَسْمَعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: For them therein is groaning and therein they hear not.ᵃ

verses.verseString: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ سَبَقَتْ لَهُمْ مِنَّا الْحُسْنَىٰ أُولَٰئِكَ عَنْهَا مُبْعَدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Those for whom the good has already gone forth from Us, they will be kept far off from it a—

verses.verseString: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ حَسِيسَهَا ۖ وَهُمْ فِي مَا اشْتَهَتْ أَنْفُسُهُمْ خَالِدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They will not hear the faintest sound of it and they will abide in that which their souls desire.ᵃ

verses.verseString: لَا يَحْزُنُهُمُ الْفَزَعُ الْأَكْبَرُ وَتَتَلَقَّاهُمُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ هَٰذَا يَوْمُكُمُ الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: The great Terror will not grieve them, and the angels will meet them: This is your day which you were promised.

verses.verseString: يَوْمَ نَطْوِي السَّمَاءَ كَطَيِّ السِّجِلِّ لِلْكُتُبِ ۚ كَمَا بَدَأْنَا أَوَّلَ خَلْقٍ نُعِيدُهُ ۚ وَعْدًا عَلَيْنَا ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا فَاعِلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: The day when We roll up heaven like the rolling up of the scroll of writings. As We began the first creation, We shall reproduce it. A promise (binding) on Us. We shall bring it about.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ كَتَبْنَا فِي الزَّبُورِ مِنْ بَعْدِ الذِّكْرِ أَنَّ الْأَرْضَ يَرِثُهَا عِبَادِيَ الصَّالِحُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And certainly We wrote in the Book after the reminder that My righteous servants will inherit the land.ᵃ

verses.verseString: إِنَّ فِي هَٰذَا لَبَلَاغًا لِقَوْمٍ عَابِدِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely in this is a message for a people who serve (Us).

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ إِلَّا رَحْمَةً لِلْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We have not sent thee but as a mercy to the nations.ᵃ

verses.verseString: قُلْ إِنَّمَا يُوحَىٰ إِلَيَّ أَنَّمَا إِلَٰهُكُمْ إِلَٰهٌ وَاحِدٌ ۖ فَهَلْ أَنْتُمْ مُسْلِمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Say: It is only revealed to me that your God is one God: will you then submit?

verses.verseString: فَإِنْ تَوَلَّوْا فَقُلْ آذَنْتُكُمْ عَلَىٰ سَوَاءٍ ۖ وَإِنْ أَدْرِي أَقَرِيبٌ أَمْ بَعِيدٌ مَا تُوعَدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: But if they turn back, say: I have warned you in fairness, and I know not whether that which you are promised is near or far.

verses.verseString: إِنَّهُ يَعْلَمُ الْجَهْرَ مِنَ الْقَوْلِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تَكْتُمُونَ

5a. The Quraish seem to have been quite puzzled — and hostile critics of the Qur’ån are still puzzled — what they could liken the Qur’ån to.       30a. The heavens and the earth may stand here for the whole universe, or for the      solar system in particular, which has developed out of a nebular mass, and the fatq or      separation may refer to the starry creation or to the throwing off of the planets of the      solar system, and the great symmetry of its arrangement and the motions of the various      bodies. There is a reference to the orbits of the various planets further on in v.       33. But      there may also be a deeper allusion in the closing up of the heavens and the earth to the      cessation of Divine revelation for a time before the advent of the Holy Prophet, which      was marked by the absence of a prophet in the world for six hundred years and the      prevalence of corruption all over the world. The opening up of the heavens and the earth      would in this case signify the coming of revelation, which brought life to the world. In      physical nature too, rain opens up the earth.

      30b.       63a. Note that there is a pause after the words bal fa‘ala-h∂, and the statement      kabßru-hum hådhå is an independent statement. Fa‘ala-h∂ thus means some doer has      done it (Rz). The word bal is not necessarily a particle of digression, implying the      negation of what precedes it, often denoting no more than and or surely. Thus LL says:      “Sometimes it is used to denote the passing from one subject to another without      cancelling what precedes it and is synonymous with wåw, as in the saying in the Qur’ån,      85:20,       21”. The other passage, kabßru-hum hådhå, being an independent statement,      means the chief of them is this, because it was left unbroken by Abraham. Then follows      the statement, so ask them, if they can speak. Ask the idols, they were told. They were      taken as gods who could benefit their worshippers, or harm others, yet they were not      able to help themselves. They were shattered to pieces, yet they could do no harm to      their shatterer. Nor could they even tell their votaries who was responsible for this. It      should be further noted that Abraham never tried to conceal what he had done. In fact,      before breaking the idols he had warned the people that he would plan against their      idols; see v.       57. This he declared publicly when carrying on a controversy with them.      The object of sparing the chief idol was, as made clear in v.       58, that haply they might      return to it.       87b. Here we are told that Jonah went away in wrath, and evidently what is meant is      that he was wroth with his people and left them for another place.       104a. Several statements are made in this verse. The first is the rolling up of the      heaven like a written scroll. This means that the old order will be swept away altogether,      just as when a writing is finished, it is rolled up. This no doubt happened in Arabia at the      appearance of the Holy Prophet. The old order was entirely gone and a new civilization      had taken its place. The thoroughness of the transformation, in all fields of human      activity, as brought about by the Prophet, is a fact now universally admitted. But then      follows the statement: As We began the first creation, We shall reproduce it. The      sweeping away of the old order no doubt meant that a new order would be created. This      is the first creation referred to here — the bringing about of a new order at the Prophet’s      appearance. And then we are told, that the new order will be reproduced again. This      reproduction is in reference to what has been stated in the first part of the section — that      Gog and Magog will dominate the whole world, and thus they would overcome even      Islåm. The spiritual resuscitation to which Islåm gave rise would thus receive a set-back      by the predominance of a material outlook of the world through the prevalence of Gog      and Magog, but this set-back, we are here told, would be only temporary, and a spiritual      awakening like the first spiritual awakening would then be brought about in the whole      world. This statement is followed by the words: A Promise binding on Us. The promise      of the ultimate triumph of Truth in the whole world is of frequent occurrence in the Holy      Qur’ån in earlier as well as in later revelation, and the temporary set-back indicated here      is also frequently mentioned, and on one occasion at least it is made fully clear that it      will be a set-back extending over a thousand years (32:5); see 32:5a.
